intro: Piptocarpha riedelii, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish to greenish flowers that are clustered in dense, cylindrical heads. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Piptocarpha riedelii is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
